intro: Gaylussacia pseudovaccinium var. glabra, commonly known as smooth leatherleaf, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, commonly referred to as the heath or heather family. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, urn-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in forested areas. The species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as bogs and swamps.
